2022 Goals: Balance. So set your health goals with this delicious and easy Cauliflower steak that can be done in under 10 minutes! Perfect for those vegans and vegetarians in your life, Gordon's got you covered. 

Order Ramsay in 10 Now to get the Full Recipe: http://hyperurl.co/Ramsayin10
Made with Hexclad - Get Cookin' with HexClad today: http://www.hexclad.com

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay

You never slice this piping hot, you're gonna burst the steak and lose all that amazing flavor. Kimchi rice is just delicious. It's crispy, it's spicy. The secret behind the recipe is to make sure we've got that wonderful sweetness against the tart against the sweetness. Rhubarb tarts take less than 10 minutes to make. snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Makes a Quick and Easy Dessert in Under 15 Minutes
snippet.description:
Looking for the perfect dessert to make at home and not take hours? Well this week on Ramsay in 10 Gordon is cooking up a Rhubarb Tart that, well, breaks the 10 minute rule....slightly. Using store bought puff pastry, rhubarb and finishing it with a delicious blood orange topping. There's no reason not to make dessert...quick.

summary: Ramsay shows you how to make a delicious spiced batch cup chicken with a green goddess sauce. The secret behind this is that we're gonna flatten the chicken out over the grill, skin, side down first. Ramsay likes to get this sort of marinaded the day before because those spices literally turn the color of that skin beautifully. Ramsay demonstrates how to make croutons and a green goddess sauce in just 10 minutes. Ramsay's recipe is inspired by his 10 cookbooks inspired by the Ramsay 10 Cookbooks series. The recipes are available on Ramsay's website and on his YouTube channel, click here to watch it.

Need the perfect Chicken dish for the holidays and want to spend more time with friends and family? snippet.title: Thai-Style Meatballs in Under in 10 Minutes | Gordon Ramsay

Throughout Gordon's travels in Asia, he's tasted so many variations on meatballs. So today on Ramsay in 10 he's making Lamb Meatballs with Lettuce Cups and Crispy Rice inspired by his trip to Thailand. Quick, easy and packed with flavor these can be done quick. But will Uncle Roger approve?

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Makes Spicy Cornflake Chicken Sliders in Under 10 Minutes
snippet.description:
To celebrate the release of the Ramsay in 10 cookbooks in the US, Gordon is cooking up a delicious spicy chicken slider perfect for dinner, that football or soccer match, or at home with family and friends. With a little spicy Korean flare, this is a stunner 

Order Ramsay in 10 Now to get the Full Recipe: http://hyperurl.co/Ramsayin10
Made with Hexclad - Get Cookin' with HexClad today: http://www.hexclad.com

Follow Gordon: 
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@gordonramsayofficial
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram 
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay   
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay

#GordonRamsay #Food #Cooking #Chicken

The secret behind these is wash them under cold running water, gets rid of the sort of grain, sometimes a bit sand, little bit clay in there. summary: Ramen is that comfort food that we all love. especially on a cold day. But today, trust me, I'm going to show you how to elevate that notoriously cheap dish into something delicious. And guess what? Give me a V. That's right, Vegetarian, right? A simple vegetable like cauliflower can enhance a beautiful ramen. Rice flour starts to coat the cauliflower and gives it this sort of jacket that allows it to get nice and crispy. I've got my ginger sitting alongside seaweed inside and the tofu now is sort of taking on that stock.

snippet.title: Homemade Ramen Made Quick | Gordon Ramsay
snippet.description:
As autumn/fall begins to sneak in and temperatures begin to sink lower, its the perfect time to make a delicious Ramen (oh and it's Vegetarian)! Even better is this can be done in under 10 minutes! This week on Ramsay in 10 Gordon's making a delicious cauliflower and ginger ramen for you to warm up with

summary: This is a beautiful sticky toffee pudding and I promise you it's done in 10 minutes with my amazing assistant who never answers back. The big secret behind any stickers I'm putting are dates. We're gonna make the cake mix with beautiful brown sugar, butter, flour, egg and this baby here golden syrup we all grew up with that so delicious. Then on to the sauce, finish with a nice tart creme. Ramsay's Campbell Sauce recipe is inspired by the Ramsey Intent cookbook inspired by this series. Make sure it's nice and dry, brush generously with your butter and then just lightly vertically. put those strokes up that will help the sticky toffee pudding coming out and it is just a light smidging of butter from there, almost like a sort of half a tablespoon of flour.

summary: Thank you to all of you tuning in and coming up with these incredible recipes. I've got the Magnificent Three back with me today for 10 minutes only to get this amazing video done. I had the easiest A-levels in the history of school. I still have to do a little work just not the exams. I haven't got my A-level yet. For the onion gravy, I'm going to use red onion. It's so much more sweeter, less acidic than the white onion, and it gets really nice and dark in terms of the caramelization. The secret here is to get a really nice color on those sausages. I've got some garlic and some rosemary. I'm basting with the garlic and the rosemary. Jamie Oliver Delia Smith demonstrates how to make mashed potatoes. The Naked Chef's recipe is based on recipes from Marco Pierro White the Naked Chef. Jamie Oliver's recipe for the best mashed potato recipes is available on Amazon.com and PBS.com.co.uk.com. Done in 10 minutes and 57 seconds. Have a great weekend! Show me all your bangers and mash. God bless you! Have a good weekend! Share your photos with us on iReport.com/stunning mash.com. Visit www.mailonline.co.uk for details.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Makes Quick & Easy Bangers & Mash | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon's back at home this week cooking a British Classic, Bangers and Mash, trying to achieve it in under 10 minutes...but will he do it??? This week he'll also show you how to make a delicious mashed potatoes without any butter! If you enjoy Ramsay in 10, be sure to post your recipes on Instagram and Twitter and tag Gordon. Who knows....he may even post it! 

Full Recipe here: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/bangers-and-mash-in-10-minutes/

INGREDIENTS: 
PORK SAUSAGE
POTATOES
RED ONION
GARLIC
CHIVES
ROSEMARY
BEEF STOCK (OR ANY STOCK)
OLIVE OIL
WORCESTERSHIRE SAUCE
BALSAMIC VINEGAR
GRAIN MUSTARD
SMOKED SALT

Follow Gordon:

Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay 
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay 
#Cooking #CookwithMe
tags: gordon ramsay bangers and mash recipe

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Cooks Steak & Potatoes in Under 10 Minutes from Home | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon's back for another Ramsay in 10 from home this time making a Steak and Potatoes with a Delicious Chimicurri. And for only the second time as Gordon cooks at home Live, he gets this dish done in under 10 minutes! This a simple, easy and delicious way to make a perfect steak! Gordon wants to see your dish, don't forget to post it on Instagram and tag @gordonrgram and he may praise it or roast it! 

Full recipe: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/steak-with-chimichurri-and-potatoes-from-ramsay-in-10-live/ 

INGREDIENTS: 
Sirloin Steak 
Garlic 
Spring Onion 
Red Wine Vinegar 
Olive Oil 
Honey 
Mushrooms 
Chili 
Parsley 
Mint 
Basil 
Lemon 
Tomatoes
Rosemary 


Follow Gordon:
Text him: +1 (310) 620-6468
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay 
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay 
#Cooking #CookwithMe

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Shows How To Make An Easy Curry At Home | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon was back at it this weekend attempting to make another dish in 10 minutes...well almost 10 minutes. This time it was a delicious Butternut Squash Curry! Did he make in 10 minutes? Not quite, but he had reasons including a bonus Roti bread that you can make in under 2 minutes flat. Be sure to share your dish on the Community tab as well as Instagram, Facebook and Twitter by tagging Gordon! 

Full Recipe here: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/quick-butternut-squash-curry/

INGREDIENTS: 
2 Chicken Breasts Diced 
Butternut Squash 
Red Onion 
Ginger 
Spinach 
Peas
Canned Tomatoes 
Coconut Milk 
Curry Powder 
Chicken or Vegetable Stock 
Red Chili (optional) 


Follow Gordon:
Text him: +1 (310) 620-6468
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay 
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay 
#CookwithMe #StayHome

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Cooks Carbonara in Under 10 Minutes | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon was live yesterday and showed everyone at home how easy it is to make a Carbonara Pasta in under 10 minutes! Even with some tough talk from his daughter Tilly, Gordon is actually able to finish his live dish in under 10 minutes! 

Full recipe: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/gordons-carbonara-in-under-10-minutes/

INGREDIENTS: 
Streaky Bacon or Pancetta
Spaghetti 
Egg Yolks
Mushrooms
Garlic 
Hot Pepper 
Peas
Creme Fraiche
Grana Padano Parmesan Cheese 
Salt & Pepper 
Oil 
Parsley 

Follow Gordon:
Text him: +1 (310) 620-6468
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay 
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay 
#CookwithMe #StayHome

summary: Remedy in 10 shows you how to cook the most amazing dish in 10 minutes. Today's dish is a beautiful pan-seared sea Bass where they sort of Mediterranean light tomato, eggplant or aubergine olive chili sauce. The less time you have, the thinner you slice it, there's no fast track. That's why I Love using these little ones and they're less bitter than the big ones. Narvik shows how to make dinner in 10 minutes and 40 seconds using leftovers from leftovers. The Mediterranean sauce can be made a day to three days in advance as it sits in the fridge. Narvik says it's a great way to use leftovers and really makes a nice refreshing sauce.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Cooks Mediterranean Sea Bass in Under 10 Minutes | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Looking for that simple and easy meal to impress your family, wife, roommate or significant other as you #StayHome this weekend? Well Gordon's got the recipe to do the trick! This video was shot in early 2020 before Gordon quarantined and had his family as his production team

Full Recipe: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/r10seabass  

Follow Gordon:
Text him: +1 (310) 620-6468
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay 
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay 
#CookwithMe

Yield 1:
8 oz  Sea Bass filets-skin on
½ Cup Eggplant/Aubergine, Sliced 
1 Shallots, Sliced 
1 large Garlic, Sliced 
6 Heirloom Cherry Tomatoes
2 Tablespoons White Wine 
2 Tablespoons Tomato Puree
3 Tablespoons Vegetable Stock 
2 Tablespoons Olives- sliced 
4-5 Sundreid Tomatoes
1 Calabrian Chilies, sliced
Salt and Pepper 
Olive Oil
1 Sprig Oregano leaves, Smashed 
1 Lemon zest and juice
1 cup Israeli Cous Cous (can be made in 10 minutes or use leftover - follow directions on box or bag)
 
Method:
Warm couscous or cook per instructions. 

Start by heating a pan and adding a tablespoon of oil, start with eggplant and let brown and soften. Grate some fresh lemon zest over and season. 

Remove eggplant on towel

Add a teaspoon of oil and add sliced shallots and garlic to pan, let soften 

Then add sun-dried tomatoes, large diced pieces of chilies. Deglaze with white wine and add vegetable stock and tomato puree and mix. Then add tomatoes, olives and fresh torn oregano leaves. Add a tablespoon of olive oil and lemon zest to finish. Take off heat. 

Meanwhile heat separate pan with olive oil, season fish and sear skin side down, flip fish after 4- 5 min.

Add 1 slice worth of lemon juice to couscous

Plate cous cous, top with tomato sauce and fish, garnish with parsley sprig/ lemon wedge

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Attempts To Make Fish & Chips at Home in 10 Minutes | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
This week on Ramsay in 10 Live, Gordon tackled a British Classic....Fish & Chips. Simple and easy to do at home, As he and the Ramsay family #StayHome, Gordon shows you how to make this Classic by Shallow Frying but can he get it done in 10 Minutes? Leave a comment about what dish you want to see next weekend so you can #cookwithme? 

Full Recipe: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/gordons-fish-and-chips-in-10-minutes

Ingredients
Self Rising Flour
White Fleshed Fish (such as Cod)
Egg White
Light Beer or Lager
Potato 
Sunflower Oil 
Salt 
Curry Powder
Baking Powder
Lemon 
Gherkin
Creme Fraiche 
Mayonnaise 
Shallot 
Hot Sauce (Optional)

Follow Gordon:
Text him: +1 (310) 620-6468
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay
tags: gordon ramsay fish and chips recipe
how to cook fish and chips

summary: We've got 10 minutes to make this burger, and I've got more time than I have tonight. We have a new Director of Photography, Matilda, who started filming at 12.30am today. We should put our braces on as today let's go to yours now. We're not all about you, it's about food. And then look, Meg I'm tilling it down, Pan down, Meg, Meg and Timmy. The chef uses a pan and pan to cook a chili burger in a bid to get the best taste of the chili. The chef says he loves onions but what he doesn't love is the raw onion. He says the buns should be toasted so it takes the weight of the burger toasted. Panda Panda Caramelized onions are delicious. You'll eat way more grilled than you will raw. Don't forget to hashtag Me! And more importantly, if it's good enough, I'll share it. If it's bad enough, he'll still share it.

snippet.title: Can Gordon Ramsay Cook a Burger in 10 Minutes for a Front-Line Workers Charity? | Ramsay In 10
snippet.description:
Gordon went live this weekend to put himself to his biggest challenge yet....cook a burger in 10 Minutes or donate £10,000 to the NHS Charities Together. Find out if he's able to do it as Gordon and and his family #StayHome. And don't forget to join him weekly as he attempts to show you simple, easy meals that you can do in 10 Minutes. 

Donate Today in the UK: https://virg.in/NHSCovid19

Full Recipe: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/gordons-burger-in-10-minutes/ 

INGREDIENTS: 
1/2 LB of Ground Beef 
1 Egg 
Bun
Lettuce 
Frozen Chili 
Bacon 
Onion 
Mayonnaise
Sriracha
Slice of Cheddar Cheese 
Tomato
Lettuce
Grapeseed Oil

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Shows How To Make a Stir Fry at Home | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
As Gordon continues to #StayHome he's putting himself to more 10 minute challenges live! This week on Ramsay in 10 Live, he attempted to make a delicious stir fry using easily accessible ingredients at home including leftover rice! Join Gordon weekly as he shows you how easy it is to #CookwithMe. 

Follow Gordon:  
Text him: +1 (310) 620-6468
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay

Full recipe: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/gordons-10-minute-stir-fry

INGREDIENTS: 
Ground Beef 
Leftover Rice 
Mushroom 
Ginger 
Red Onion 
Red & Yellow Pepper
Snow Peas 
Spring Onions/Scallions 
Bok Choy
Egg
Chile
Garlic 
Soy Sauce 
Fish Sauce (Optional)

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Shows How To Make A Lamb Chop Dish At Home | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon went live on Saturday on from his home to show the world how easy it is cook lamb from home with just a few ingredients as we all #StayHome. Gordon, also celebrated Oscar's first birthday with Tana, Tilly and all the kids! But did he find the lamb sauce? So come #CookwithMe as we navigated these times. 

Follow Gordon:  
Text him: +1 (310) 620-6468
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/gordongram
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gordonramsay
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/GordonRamsay

Full Recipe here: https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/gordons-10-minute-lamb-chops

INGREDIENTS: 
Lamb Chops
Mushrooms
Red Onion
New Potatoes (Leftovers are fine)
Frozen Peas
Butter
Oil 
Mustard
Cider Vinegar 
Extra Virgin Olive Oil 
Chiptole paste 
Garlic 
Salt and Pepper 
Spring Onions

So let's do some time on the clock and let's get cooking. So right here: I'm gonna make the custard to dip the french toast in I'm gonna put about half a cup of half-and-half a couple of eggs. So basic French toast Ingredients: A little bit of cardamom I love that warm sort of floral flavor that cardamom has. and I'm gonna do a little bit of orange zest. Just make sure when you zest an orange or any citrus you don't get all the way down to the pit which is the white part. Then we're gonna do a little bit of vanilla, sprinkle of salt. Let's get all together. Let me tell you something, being in this kitchen is so much easier than house kitchen because I don't have to worry about Chef Ramsay yelling down my throat. so we have the custard down and then now I'm gonna make a crust for the French toast. So during the week this may be a smoothie maker, but today we're gonna use it to make a restaurant-quality breakfast. You have anyone at home or if you're cooking for your family or lateness plane doesn't matter. This will really impress them because it adds a different element to your french toast. So we're gonna add about I don't know, like a cup or two of corn flakes. and if you don't have this little butter you can always just put it in a plastic bag I can just pound it with anything. couple spoonfuls of brown sugar so that it gets nice and golden and caramelized and to cardamom throughout the whole - and there's always just a little bit of salt there we go that just goes right next to the custard. Then we have a nice brioche loaf and I like buying the whole loaf so that I can control the thickness of the bread and that's what it's gonna make your french toast look a lot fancier. All that soaks. we can start going on the whipped cream that's gonna go on top of our french toast and it's really easy. It's just cream. a little bit of Grand Marnier which is orange liqueur and if you don't have Grand Marnier just orange zest. Oh that's just fine. I just want to get fancy. It's perfect for the late night flakes. Remember we're trying to do this in ten minutes so I'm working Two things right now. The French toast is soaking. so was your french toast. soaks up that nice custard. We're just gonna move it real quick to our sweet bread crumbs so to speak. Then we're going straight to the pan. Well, that cuts. We're gonna finish our whipped cream and it's gonna be so much more impressive than the stuff that you buy in a can. So as soon as you start getting ribbons like this, I'm gonna add some powdered sugar and I just a little by little and taste for sweetness so it's really up to you how much sugar you have. Start with. Be careful not to over whip it because it'll end up looking like butter a little separate. That should be good right there. How much time do I have? Okay, awesome, all right. so I have one minute left. So I have to get this all finished. It's actually made this at home One time for my boyfriend one day that we didn't want to go to brunch and spend money and I wanted to impress him. So I decided to do a corn flakes and blew his mind. So we've been doing it like this ever since. These are ready, but if you want to make sure that it's cooked in the middle, you can just throw it in the oven for a couple minutes and it should be fine. So we're just going straight on the plate with this and just gonna dust it with a little bit of powdered sugar. Top it off with some of that nice whipped cream. I Like to do fresh zest on top and that's how you make a fancy breakfast in 10 minutes. Gordon Please leave a comment below and let me know what you thought of my recipe. We'll see you again soon! Hi I'm Mia Castro I'm in Gordon's sorry.

She shows you how you don't have to go to a fancy brunch to have a fancy breakfast. Please leave a comment below and let me know what you thought of my recipe.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay's Perfect Cereal French Toast Challenge | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon is putting the challenge out to Hell’s Kitchen Finalist Mia Castro to see if she can make the perfect French toast of that weekend brunch....in just 10 minutes. This recipe isn’t just quick but adds some cereal for some extra crunch! Recipe below: 

Cardamom-Spiced French Toast with Fresh, Orange Whipped Cream

Yield: 2 servings

For the whipped cream:

½ C heavy whipping cream 
1 ea. Orange zest
2-4 T powdered sugar 
¼ t salt 
2 t Grand Marnier

Method:

In a medium bowl, with a whisk, start beating cream with the orange zest until it begins to thicken. Add sugar, 1 T at a time, tasting until you achieve desired sweetness.
Add salt.  
Continue whisking until soft-medium peaks form. 
Finish by whisking in Grand Marnier. 
Taste, adjust flavor, set aside cold. 

For cornflake crust:

2 C cornflakes
2 T brown sugar
½ t cardamom
Pinch salt 

Method:

 In a food processor, place all ingredients and pulse until it resembles breadcrumbs.


For french toast:

¾ C Half & Half
3 lg. eggs
2 T brown sugar
¾ t cardamom
¼ t salt
2 ea., ¾“ brioche slices
1 C cornflake crust
2-3 T butter

Method:

 Blend the first four ingredients at medium speed until homogenous.
 Soak brioche in the mixture for 3-4 minutes (turning a few times). 
With cornflake crust on a shallow plate, place soaked bread over it, turning to coat both sides.
 In a shallow pan with butter, over medium-high heat, cook french toast until golden-brown on both sides. Finish in 450F oven if necessary. 

Serve with a dollop of fresh whipped cream and pure maple syrup.

2 T brown sugar
¾ t cardamom
¼ t salt
2 ea., ¾“ brioche slices
1 C cornflake crust
2-3 T butter

Method:

 Blend the first four ingredients at medium speed until homogenous.
 Soak brioche in the mixture for 3-4 minutes (turning a few times). 
With cornflake crust on a shallow plate, place soaked bread over it, turning to coat both sides.
 In a shallow pan with butter, over medium-high heat, cook french toast until golden-brown on both sides. Finish in 450F oven if necessary. 

Serve with a dollop of fresh whipped cream and pure maple syrup.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Challenges Hell’s Kitchen Contestant To A Holiday Leftover Dish | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Thanksgiving is next week and Gordon is putting the challenge out to Hell’s Kitchen Finalist and Challenge Queen Mia Castro to make a stunning dish out of some Thanksgiving leftovers…in just 10 Minutes. This leftover Thanksgiving Breakfast Hash will take the pain out of any Thanksgiving Hangover you may have! Full recipe below:
#GordonRamsay #Thanksgiving

Thanksgiving Hash

Yield: 2 servings

For hash:

⅓ C onion, small diced
1 C leftover ham/roast pork/turkey, small diced 
1 ea. Medium Yukon potato, small diced 
1-2 T grapeseed oil
1-2 T butter 
¼ C “bottom of the bag” crumbled plantain chips 
2 T chives, sliced 
2-4 ea. eggs

Method:

Drop diced potatoes in a 350F fryer, and fry until golden (3-5 minutes).
In a large pan, over medium-high heat, add oil, onions, and leftover meat. Saute until meat is golden brown and onions are translucent (3-5 minutes). Add cooked potatoes, butter, and season with salt. Garnish with chives. Serve. Add crumbled chips. 
Top with a sunny side up eggs.

Welcome, to Ramsay in 10. Hi, I'm chef Mia Castro, and chef Ramsay challenged me today to make a pasta dish under 10 minutes. and I'm making an all-time college favourite ramen Cacio e Pepe It's pasta with Cacio - cheese, pepe - pepper, And, I'm using ramen because it cooks within 2 - 3 minutes. And You probably have it in your pantry anyways already. So, let's start the clock and lets get started. This is some, fresh ramen. If You don't have fresh ramen, which you can find in the refrigerated section at, like your organic grocery store. You can just use, your traditional, Uhm, your traditional package ramen. They both cook in under 10 minutes. The Fresh one cooks in 2 - 3 because it's fresh. And The one in the package cooks in about the same time So All these ingredients are staples in my kitchen, so it's really easy for me to make when I've came home from a busy day at work or when it's really cold outside. and I want something hearty. In here, I have a preheated pan. Just A little too hot, so I'm gonna let it cool down and I'm gonna put some olive oil, some butter They have Gordon's fancy Peppermill here If you don't have this at home,, they sell them at the grocery store the disposable kind, either one works the same, you're gonna get the same quality meal. And I Like to do the pepper straight into the butter, Cuz it gets it really aromatic. This is another one of those dishes where you don't have to measure everything, you kind of want to do everything by tasting so it depends on how spicy you like it, how much pepper you're gonna add. I'm putting all the directions below anyway, just in case you need it, but it should be pretty easy for you to make.. I'm just gonna test one of these noodles. Great. So I'm gonna go straight into the pan with the noodles. And It's actually good if you get some of that pasta water in there. Because It will help you make a sauce with the starch Bring it onto the pan. Stir it around and I'm gonna add a little bit of that pasta water in here and what that does is it makes a really nice sauce. When you combine it with the cheese This is fresh grated Pecorino, you can use Parmesan as well, but I prefer the sharpness of the Pecorino. Few handfuls. Move it around. And you can see there how the sauce is starting to form. Pasta is one of my favorite things to eat, but I don't always have time or I don't always really want to cook. so I like using ramen in place of pasta in a lot of dishes. and I actually lived off of it in college and I would make all sorts of different things. Spaghetti, the Cacio e Pepe, carbonara, you can use it anything. Go with a little bit more water. And The beauty of ramen noodles is that it cooks a lot faster than regular pasta and it's cheap. So You don't have to go to a restaurant to get this dish. I'm gonna go ahead and taste it. A Little bit more salt. So You need to be a little more careful when you're using the traditional packaged ramen because they cook faster so you probably want to cook them a little less when they're in the water.. And as soon as they get really nice and creamy and you get a really nice tight sauce like that. They're ready to serve. I Have plenty of time to make this look great right now. So You want to get fancy, you just give it that nice swirl on top with the tongs. Give it a little height. Picture-perfect. and then just finish it off with a sprinkling of Pecorino and some fresh cracked pepper. This is a dish that you can make in well under 10 minutes. So There's no excuse for you not to make this at home. So, boom. Ramen Cacio E Pepe, Gordon. Under 10 minutes and under $10. Leave A comment below on what you think of this dish. and don't forget to subscribe to Gordon's YouTube channel. See you next time. Oh My God when I was in ramen. Sorry *laughs*

summary: Ramsay challenges chef Mia Castro to make a pasta dish under 10 minutes. Ramsay in 10: Make Cacio e Pepe with Cacio - cheese, pepe - pepper, and use ramen because it cooks within 2 - 3 minutes. The beauty of ramen noodles is that it cooks a lot faster than regular pasta and it's cheap.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Challenges Hell's Kitchen Contestant For Gourmet Ramen | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon’s putting the challenge out to Hell’s Kitchen Finalist and Challenge Queen Mia Castro to make a stunning entrée in just 10 Minutes. And today she’s turning a college staple into are that you can make in just 10 minutes. But this isn’t the microwavable ramen you made in college as Mia’s turning it into a delicious Cacio e Pepe. Gordon would approve of. Recipe below:

Fresh Ramen Cacio e Pepe Ingredients:

2 ea. Fresh ramen servings (refrigerated section at Whole Foods, by the tofu) 
1 ½ C pecorino Romano, fresh grated 
2 T black pepper, fresh cracked 
2-3 T extra virgin olive oil
2-3 T butter

Method:

In a medium pot with salted, boiling water, add fresh ramen and stir to prevent clumping. Cooks in 2-3 minutes.
In a separate, large pan, over medium heat, add 1 T (each) of butter, olive oil, and black pepper. Stir until pepper is aromatic. Butter should have no color. 
Add cooked ramen with (approx.) ½ C of starchy cooking water and ¾ C of grated cheese. 
With a medium flame on, toss, adding more cheese/butter/pepper/starchy water to taste until a creamy consistency is achieved. 
Serve on two bowls. Finish with a fresh grating of pecorino and cracked pepper. 
It can be topped with a fried or poached (runny) egg if desired for more protein/richness.

Mia Can you make the delicious breakfast in ten? Welcome to Ramsey in Ten I am Mia Castro And you may remember me from Hell's Kitchen I'm in Chef Ramsay's Kitchen Today he's challenged me to make breakfast. and today I'm making my recipe for pumpkin spice pancakes with this recipe. I'm showing you why. There's no excuse why you can't make breakfast in 10 minutes or less I Ready to get started! Let's put the time on the clock right here. I Just have my dry ingredients. They're actually gluten free. So we have some almond flour and we're doing about a half a cup. Then we have some arrowroot starch for lightness. we have some baking powder, a couple teaspoons, and some salt. Add a teaspoon. Let's get all together. We just want to incorporate all of that. So it's even set aside for a second that were combining all of our wet ingredients. I Just eyeball it. It's about a cup of pumpkin puree and you should have this on hand from your Thanksgiving meal. We probably have some leftovers so that should be easy Three eggs. So then we're doing a teaspoon of vanilla. Combine all of this really well, adding some chai spice mix into our dry spices. and I just make a premade mix at home and it's a combination of ginger, cardamom, cinnamon cloves, allspice little nutmeg. I Like to make them ahead of time and just have it on hand. For other dishes, you can put it in french toast or put it over your coffee and then we mix in the wet and the dry. I'm just gonna transfer some of this batter into a measuring cup so it's easy to pour. so I have a griddle pan right here. I'm just gonna spray it with some coconut oil and if you don't have one, that's fine. you can just use a nonstick pan at home. I'm gonna do about a quarter cup for pancake and we're gonna cook them until they're just set on the sides and they're starting to bubble in the center. Then while these cook, I'm going to make a quick sauce for them to make them a little harder. What I have here is a little bit of melted coconut oil and so we just want to get our coconut oil nice and warm to melt this almond butter that I'm about to put in. I'm gonna do about half a cup of almond butter. maybe like don't forget your pancakes, we're gonna burn them. then when they start bubbling in the middle like this means they're ready and then I like to spray them on top [Applause] I Don't have to look perfect, it's just breakfast and you're home. but they're gonna be delicious. So while those cook I'm gonna finish my almond butter sauce. and the reason why I do this is So I'm not dousing them that much with maple syrup and I'm avoiding a little bit of that sugar and we're going with a little bit of this maple syrup to sweeten it just a bit and some of the chive spices to keep going with that theme. A little vanilla and a little bit of salt and everything that's sweet and you want to turn the heat off. You don't want it to get too hot because the almond butter will melt, just needs a little bit of sweetness and these pancakes are ready. So we're ready to serve what's the time right now. So finish it with this almond butter sauce. It's nice and sweet and salty. Some more chai spices and that's it. So another challenge I proved Gordon right. Pumpkin pancakes in ten minutes! Thank you so much for joining me! Let me know what you think in the comments below. Don't forget to subscribe to Gordon's YouTube channel for more! Ramsay Intent.

summary: Ramsay challenged Mia Castro to make breakfast in ten minutes or less. The Hell's Kitchen star says there's no excuse why you can't make it in 10 minutes. Here she shows you how easy it is to make pumpkin pancakes with this recipe for pumpkin spice pancakes. The show airs tonight at 8pm ET on CBS.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Challenges A Hell's Kitchen Finalist To Make A Pumpkin Spice Breakfast | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
This week on Ramsay in 10, Gordon is putting the challenge out to Hell's Kitchen's Mia Castro to make an amazing homemade breakfast in just 10 minutes. And Mia is feeling fall and is showing you how a delicious recipe for Pumpkin Spice Pancakes in just 10 Minutes! Check out the full recipe below 

Don't forget to Pre-Order Gordon's Newest Cookbook Quick and Delicious: http://po.st/VdFBEt 

Pumpkin Pancakes with Creamy Almond Sauce Yield: 2 servings

For pancakes:
1 C pumpkin puree
3 ea. Lg. eggs
1 t vanilla 
2 t baking powder
½ C almond flour
½ C arrowroot starch
1 ½ t chai spices (cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, allspice, cloves, nutmeg) 
¼ t salt 
coconut oil spray 
3-4 T butter (for serving)
Pure maple syrup (for serving)
Creamy almond sauce (for serving)

Method:

In a medium bowl, whisk together pumpkin, eggs, and vanilla until homogenous.  

In a separate bowl, whisk together dry ingredients. Add to wet ingredients. Whisk until just combined. 

Heat a griddle pan (large saute pan alternatively) to medium, spray with coconut oil, and place ½ C of batter per pancake. 

Cook 1st side until set around edges and bubbling in the center (should be light golden). Flip and cook other side until light-golden as well. 

Stack cooked pancakes on top of each other and cover with a clean kitchen towel to keep warm. 

Repeat until batter is finished. 

Serve pancakes stack. Top with pure maple syrup and whipped cream. 

For almond sauce :
½ C liquid unrefined coconut oil (Nutiva)
½ C creamy almond butter (MaraNatha 1 ingredient, roasted)
½ C maple syrup
1 t vanilla extract
1/2 t chai spices powdered sugarPinch salt 

Method:

 In a small pot heat coconut oil until just warm. Turn off heat, whisk in the rest of the ingredients until homogenous, reserve.

localized.title: Gordon Ramsay Challenges A Hell's Kitchen Finalist To Make A Pumpkin Spice Breakfast | Ramsay in 10
localized.description:
This week on Ramsay in 10, Gordon is putting the challenge out to Hell's Kitchen's Mia Castro to make an amazing homemade breakfast in just 10 minutes. And Mia is feeling fall and is showing you how a delicious recipe for Pumpkin Spice Pancakes in just 10 Minutes! Check out the full recipe below 

Don't forget to Pre-Order Gordon's Newest Cookbook Quick and Delicious: http://po.st/VdFBEt 

Pumpkin Pancakes with Creamy Almond Sauce Yield: 2 servings

For pancakes:
1 C pumpkin puree
3 ea. Lg. eggs
1 t vanilla 
2 t baking powder
½ C almond flour
½ C arrowroot starch
1 ½ t chai spices (cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, allspice, cloves, nutmeg) 
¼ t salt 
coconut oil spray 
3-4 T butter (for serving)
Pure maple syrup (for serving)
Creamy almond sauce (for serving)

Method:

In a medium bowl, whisk together pumpkin, eggs, and vanilla until homogenous.  

In a separate bowl, whisk together dry ingredients. Add to wet ingredients. Whisk until just combined. 

Heat a griddle pan (large saute pan alternatively) to medium, spray with coconut oil, and place ½ C of batter per pancake. 

Cook 1st side until set around edges and bubbling in the center (should be light golden). Flip and cook other side until light-golden as well. 

Stack cooked pancakes on top of each other and cover with a clean kitchen towel to keep warm. 

Repeat until batter is finished. 

Serve pancakes stack. Top with pure maple syrup and whipped cream. 

For almond sauce :
½ C liquid unrefined coconut oil (Nutiva)
½ C creamy almond butter (MaraNatha 1 ingredient, roasted)
½ C maple syrup
1 t vanilla extract
1/2 t chai spices powdered sugarPinch salt 

Method:

 In a small pot heat coconut oil until just warm. Turn off heat, whisk in the rest of the ingredients until homogenous, reserve.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Challenges Hell's Kitchen's Mia Castro To Make Poke | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Can Hell's Kitchen's Mia Castro make a Seafood Dish in just 10 Minutes? Find out this week on Ramsay in 10 as Mia puts a Puerto Rican spin on Poke and shows you a few tricks along the way. Recipe below! 

Don't forget to Pre-Order Gordon's Newest Cookbook Quick and Delicious: po.st/VdFBEt 

Puerto Rican Poke with Spicy Tuna & Avocado

Yield: 2 servings

For spicy tuna:

¼ - ½ # sushi grade, ahi tuna loin

2-4 T mayonnaise (Fabanaise, avocado oil, eggless mayo)

1-2 T gochujang (can use sriracha alternatively)

1-2 t toasted sesame oil 

Tt salt

Method:

 With a sharp knife, small dice tuna and place in a medium bowl. 

Add all ingredients in (little by little) until the right flavor/consistency is achieved.

Reserve. 

For rice cake:

1 ½ C cooked medium-grain rice 

3 T rice vinegar

2 T sugar 

½ t salt

3-4 T coconut oil (Nutiva, unrefined liquid oil) 

Spicy tuna

½ ea. Avocado

1-2 T sliced chives 

½ t Maldon salt

Method:

Heat up rice vinegar and dissolve salt and sugar into it. Stir it into hot rice.

In a small, Teflon saute pan, heat oil until it smokes. Add rice and flatten to cover the entire surface of the pan. Continue cooking (over medium-high heat) until rice is golden and crispy.

To turn, slide rice onto a plate, drizzle oil on the remaining side, and place the pan over rice.

Cook the second side until it is golden and crispy. 

Serve on a small cutting board by sliding off the pan. 

Top with spicy tuna over the entire surface. Slice into eighths (like a pizza). 

Garnish with chives and Maldon salt.

text_captions: It's tailgate season in America and I'm tired of everyone just ordering burgers on their phone. So I'm putting the challenge out there to Mia to see what she can come up with in just 10 minutes. Mia, don't disappoint.! Welcome to "Ramsay in 10". Hi Guys! I'm Mia Castro, I'm the challenge Queen from Hell's Kitchen Today Gordon Challenged me to make a burger in under 10 Minutes So I'm making my version of a Tailgate turkey burger with an avocado spread and I'm adding some potato sticks for a little bit of crunch too. So Like any good football competition, Gordon you're on. Let's start So right here I have some ground turkey What I Like to add to turkey burger is because sometimes they end up being on the dry side is some zucchini To keep them moist and I'm just gonna grate it right into here And If you don't have one of these at home, You Can just use a box grater or kind of just like rough, chop it yourself And I have some pre-chopped garlic I have some smoked paprika and I like using this because It gives food that sort of like ham or bacon flavor. We're gonna try to add as much flavor as we can into the meat Everyone needs to chill out on measuring I just I Throw things in there and you can just taste it as you go. Take a little piece of burger Throw it on the grill, taste it, if it needs more, add more some salt pepper Stir that up And If you're having people over for game day, you can just make these patties ahead of time. So When you have your guests over, all you have to do is throw them on the grill or on the pan. We Don't really watch that much football in Puerto Rico At Least my family didn't, but for any game day like if it's a boxing match or for us, It's actually the Miss Universe pageant Then I'm gonna pre-boil the pan real quick because I'm about to use my hands to form these patties So The thinner the patty, the faster its gonna cook. It's really up to you how thick you want it. I'm trying to prove Gordon right though. So I Want to finish this in 10 minutes Then Right on the pan When You get the burger on. You want to make sure that your heat is on medium-high I Like it when it gets kind of crispy around it. And That's why I actually prefer turkey burgers to beef burgers You Want a list of ingredients - just check the description below. While That's cooking, I'm gonna make a quick sauce with avocados And This is a good substitution for mayonnaise and cheese. That Way you don't feel like crap after you eat a burger. Sorry This pit is Not cooperating If The pit's not cooperating. just take it out with a fork. But These knives are so sharp. They're cutting through the pit Gordon Do you actually even use your knives here? They're so sharp. All right,? whatever. We're still good! I Got this, Gordon So Just a little bit of salt, some lemon juice This is something else that you can pre make ahead of time and a little bit of olive oil. Then Just mash it up with a fork. Alright, so don't forget your burger. I'm gonna oil it on top again a little bit so it gets nice and brown on the other side. We're gonna toast our patty So, get a little bit of butter on there. So It gets a really good golden brown color. I Actually like to season the buns a little bit so you actually taste the butter. Straight down, I Think we're gonna make it, Gordon. One Nice slice of tomato. And You can top it with whatever you want, these are just my favorite things. Flatten it Check your buns, don't burn them. Oh, so I'm getting the lettuce flat so it covers The bun really nice and I get two pieces on there. I Like to put it in the bottom so that the juice from the turkey burger doesn't Make the bun soggy going with Turkey right on top So, you know if it's done by kind of poking it in the middle and if it feels firm, it's ready to go? Let's check our bun Perfect I Like to season my tomato. A Little olive oil as well. It's getting really close now. These avocados could have ruined me. I Think they still have it though.. Magic touch..."papitas" (potatoes in Spanish) Get a lot of them on there. That's what makes it really good. And Time is ticking so I got to get this on. There We go. Oh my God, I think that was just ten minutes. Gordon, you almost had me. but there you go. Tailgate Turkey burgers in ten minutes Gracias por sintonizar a Ramsay in 10 Dejame Un comentario abajo con lo que pensaron de la hamburguesa Y no olviden suscribirse al canal de chef Gordon Ramsay en YouTube For those of you that didn't catch that Thank you for watching "Ramsay in ten". Don't forget to subscribe to Gordon's YouTube channel and leave a comment below! Gracias!

summary: "Ramsay in 10" is the challenge Queen from Hell's Kitchen. Mia Castro makes her version of a Tailgate turkey burger with an avocado spread and some potato sticks for a little bit of crunch too. Mia says she prefers turkey burgers to beef burgers and has a list of ingredients that can be pre-made. "Ramsay in 10" is Gordon Ramsay's 10th episode of his cooking show. The show is a weekly weekly show on Ramsay's YouTube channel. Don't forget to subscribe to Gordon's channel and leave a comment below! Please share your thoughts and videos of the show with us on our blog.

snippet.title: Gordon Ramsay Challenges Mia Castro To Make The Perfect Tailgate Turkey Burger | Ramsay in 10
snippet.description:
Gordon is putting the challenge out there to Hell's Kitchen Challenge Queen Mia Castro to make a delicious burger in 10 Minutes! Will Mia keep her Hell's Kitchen streak alive? This is the perfect recipe for this weekend's tailgates. Enjoy 

Mia's Tailgate Turkey Burgers

Yield: 2 servings

For Avocado Spread:

1 ea. Avocado

½ - 1 ea. Lemon juice

1 t Extra virgin olive oil

Tt Salt

Tt black pepper, fresh cracked 

Method:

In a small bowl, mash all ingredients with a fork until creamy.

Taste and adjust flavor with more lemon and/or salt. Reserve

For burger:

½ # ground turkey (85/15) 

1 ea. small zucchini, grated 

1 ea. Garlic clove, minced

½ t Pimenton (smoked paprika)

Tt salt 

1-2 T butter, soft

2 ea. Martin’s potato buns 

2 ea. Lg. Romaine lettuce leaves

2 ea.  Thin Beefsteak tomato slices 

1 C potato sticks 

Method:

Combine the first 5 ingredients with your hands and form into 2 thin patties. 

On a pan with olive oil, over medium-high heat, cook both patties until golden on both sides (about 2 minutes per side). 

While burgers cook, toast buttered buns on a pan.

On the bottom bun, place lettuce, tomato (season with salt), then patties, followed by a dollop of avocado spread,  topped with a handful of potato sticks, then the top bun. Serve.
